Builders of Gujarat

The Solanki dynasty, also known as the 'Chalukyas of Gujarat', ruled from Anhilavada (Patan). Their reign is considered the golden age of Gujarat. They rebuilt the Somnath Temple (after it was plundered by Ghaznavi) and constructed the famous Modhera Sun Temple and Rani ki Vav (Queen's Stepwell), which is now a UNESCO World Heritage site.

тЪФя╕П
Bhimdev and Muhammad Ghori

During the reign of Bhimdev I, Mahmud Ghaznavi invaded Somnath. Later, Bhimdev II (Bal Mulraj) defeated Muhammad Ghori (Mu'izz al-Din Muhammad) near Mount Abu in 1178, which was the first major defeat of a Turkic invader in India.

ЁЯУЪ
Patronage of Jainism

Solanki kings Siddharaja Jayasimha and Kumarpala were great patrons. The Jain scholar Hemachandra was in their court. Kumarpala embraced the principles of non-violence and banned animal sacrifice.
